name: Northern Shoals
economy_niches: lightship repair & careening for shallow-draft vessels
transshipment / lighterage between deep ports and inshore lanes
kelp- and shell-derived ritual reagent production
culture_adjustments: weaker centralized guild control; informal flotilla crews and boat-clans dominate
stronger salvage-pragmatism and opportunistic law (claims by working presence)
pronounced island-crew idioms and loanwords from Island Creole
more visible sea-animist rites at landing-reefs and wreck-sites
seasonal migratory labor patterns (shore crews follow shoal-exposures)
constraints: limited deep-draft berthing due to siltation and shoals
repair industry constrained to low-pressure, manual techniques
ritual magic use depends on imported/fragile reagent supply chains
notes: important waystation for northern coastal routes and navigational-augury relays
extensive wreck-fields both hazard and economic resource
practical local customs often take precedence over distant guild edicts
